supporting.text: Donald Trump was born in Queens, New York, USA, which makes him American by birthright under U.S. law.

attacks.text: Donald Trump was born in Queens, New York, USA, which makes him American by birthright under U.S. law.
While Trump was born in the U.S., his paternal grandfather was German, which could imply German heritage.
Heritage does not determine nationality; legal citizenship is based on birthplace or naturalization, not ancestry.
Trump has never held German citizenship or officially identified as German, further supporting his American nationality.

supporting.text: Donald Trump's paternal grandparents were German immigrants, but he himself has never held German citizenship.

attacks.text: Donald Trump's paternal grandparents were German immigrants, but he himself has never held German citizenship.
German ancestry does not equate to being German, as nationality is determined by citizenship or legal status, not heritage.
Cultural and linguistic ties can sometimes define nationality beyond legal citizenship, especially in diasporic communities.
Without formal recognition or self-identification as German, cultural ties alone are insufficient to claim nationality.

supporting.text: Nationality is determined by legal citizenship, and Donald Trump has only ever been a citizen of the United States.

attacks.text: Nationality is determined by legal citizenship, and Donald Trump has only ever been a citizen of the United States.
Nationality can also be determined by ancestry or heritage, and Donald Trump has German ancestry.
Ancestry does not equate to legal nationality, which is the standard definition in international law.
Some countries grant citizenship based on ancestry (e.g., Germany's 'right of blood' principle), which could theoretically apply to Trump.
Trump has never applied for or obtained German citizenship, so this theoretical possibility is irrelevant.

supporting.text: There is no record or evidence that Donald Trump has ever claimed or been recognized as a German citizen.

attacks.text: There is no record or evidence that Donald Trump has ever claimed or been recognized as a German citizen.
Donald Trump's paternal grandfather, Friedrich Trump, was born in Germany, which could imply ancestral ties to German citizenship.
Ancestral ties do not confer citizenship unless formally claimed or recognized under German law, which Donald Trump has not done.
Donald Trump has never publicly identified as German, nor has he participated in any cultural or legal processes to establish German citizenship.
